title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 December 2013 - XWiki

09:55 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> good morning, just to let you know that my full afternoon is almost booked with meetings so I won't do much this afternoon on the coding side ;)  
10:16 <cjd> Good morning Vincent, I want to appologize for being a bit of an asshole. I think my problem is that I worry a lot and I'm rather bad at expressing my concerns in a coherent way.  
10:16 <vmassol> cjd: you're definitely not an "asshole"! :)  
10:17 <cjd> Well I appreciate the complement  
10:17 <vmassol> I'd really like that we work on your main pain points with xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> which are also the pain points of a lot of us  
10:18 <vmassol> like the slow build  
10:18 <vmassol> we know stuff that we could do, we just need to do them now...  
10:18 <vmassol> somehow there are always stuff that comes up and take precendence….  
10:18 <vmassol> so we don't progress as fast as we would like...  
10:19 <cjd> I'd like to talk about the things which worry me at some point, I'm afraid that given I'm here at the office every day, my time to do things which are not assigned is not going to be available...  
10:19 <vmassol> like FTM I've trying to pinpoint the issue with creation of hundreds of wikis  
10:19 <vmassol> this has taken me 2 days so far  
10:19 <cjd> :(  
10:19 <vmassol> it's complex as I'm delving into the HSQLDB code  
10:20 <vmassol> and it doesn't reproduce all the time, so it's slow work  
10:20 <vmassol> cjd: yeah I know the feeling, it's ok, everyone helps as much as they can, given their business schedule  
10:21 <cjd> Anyway, my concerns are a bit more meta, things like "what will the next 5 year bring", "what is the plan for getting from here to there"  
10:21 <cjd> I spend a lot of time projecting the future which means I spend a lot of time worrying :)  
10:21 <vmassol> good luck with that, predicting the future is hard :)  
10:21 <cjd> sort of yes, sort of no  
10:22 <cjd> IMO  
10:51 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <msmeria> has quit  
11:13 <sburjan> Hello devs. can someone point me to the XAR for 3.1 XEM ?  
11:13 <sburjan> I'm not sure which one is  
11:18 <sburjan> vmassol ?  
11:19 <vmassol> try harder  
11:19 <vmassol> what did you do to find it?  
11:20 <vmassol> this information has to come from the maven pom right?  
11:20 <vmassol> so go to xem 3.1 branch on github  
11:21 <vmassol> (as I've just done: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/tree/xwiki-manager-3.1 )  
11:21 <vmassol> then check the pom: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/blob/xwiki-manager-3.1/xwiki-manager-wikis/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/pom.xml  
11:21 <vmassol> it says: <artifactId>xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator</artifactId>  
11:22 <vmassol> and:  
11:22 <vmassol> <groupId>org.xwiki.manager</groupId>  
11:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <vmassol> this leads you to http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/  
11:22 <vmassol> and to http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/3.1/  
11:23 <vmassol> hope you can find it by yourself next time now :)  
11:23 <vmassol> (I've tried to explain how to find it and what I or anyone has to do to find the information you asked)  
11:23 <sburjan> reading  
11:29 <sburjan> vmassol: I still don't understand how should I have known that the pom to look in for info is https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/blob/xwiki-manager-3.1/xwiki-manager-wikis/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/pom.xml  
11:29 <vmassol> because look at the other names  
11:29 <vmassol> there's no other option  
11:30 <vmassol> and you can look for <package>xar  
11:30 <sburjan> homestly, I would have gone for https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/blob/xwiki-manager-3.1/xwiki-manager-web/  
11:30 <vmassol> and?  
11:30 <vmassol> it's not a XAR  
11:30 <vmassol> you said you were looking for a XAR  
11:30 <vmassol> not for a WAR  
11:30 <sburjan> yes, for a XAR  
11:30 <sburjan> I see  
11:30 <vmassol> the URL you gave is for a WAR as you can see in it's <package>  
11:31 <vmassol> packaging actually  
11:31 <vmassol> <packaging>  
11:31 <vmassol> this is the artifact type  
11:31 <vmassol> I didn't know to look in xwiki-manager-wikis either TBH  
11:32 <vmassol> it was just the best option in term of names…  
11:32 <vmassol> my memory doesn't go that far back….

12:57 <gdelhumeau> how can I do query.addFilter("unique"); in Java ?  
12:57 <gdelhumeau> it seems the UniqueQueryFilter class does not exist  
12:57 <gdelhumeau> ok forge  
12:57 <gdelhumeau> I've found it just after asking...  
12:58 <vmassol> :)  
13:44 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:56 <sburjan> has quit  
15:08 <j-simard> Hi, which API should I use to test if users exists and to create them?  
15:08 <j-simard> I found $xwiki.usertools which seems light in functionalities  
15:09 <j-simard> And $services.wiki.user in the 5.3 but seems dedicated to subwikis (but seems to have functionalities that I need)  
15:09 <j-simard> Is there anywhere else I should look for?  
15:09 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <tmortagne> j-simard: user id is the name of a page so you can simply test if the page exist  
15:14 <j-simard> OK, seems a simpler solution to test existence, and I suppose that create the page yourself is simple too to create a new user...  
15:14 <j-simard> I'll try that, thanks  
15:14 <tmortagne> creating a user is a bi more than just create an empty page  
15:14 <j-simard> Only need a XWikiUser object?  
15:15 <tmortagne> if you don't want this user to login yes  
15:15 <j-simard> :-\  
15:16 <j-simard> I want this user be able to log  
15:16 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <tmortagne> you have various createUser APIs in XWiki class  
15:17 <tmortagne> $xwiki.xwiki  
15:17 <tmortagne> the protected XWiki class  
15:17 <tmortagne> so you will need programming right  
15:17 <tmortagne> it will make sure to create a proper user page and register it to xwikiallgroup  
15:18 <j-simard> OK, seems easier and safer to use this  
15:18 <tmortagne> yep  
15:19 <camil7> has quit  
15:20 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <cjd> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/xwiki-platform-administration-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/Registration.xml#L828  
15:20 <cjd> that function is not protected, you can call it w/o PR  
15:22 <tmortagne> cjd: that mean execute a HTTP request for each user, from what I understood j-simard is in a script  
15:22 <j-simard> Yes  
15:22 <tmortagne> (generating several users)  
15:22 <cjd> mmm right indeed  
15:22 <j-simard> Only one  
15:22 <cjd> you'd need to modify some of the post parameters in the script, probably impossible  
15:23 <tmortagne> if all your do is generating a unique user then you could use the register action then  
15:27 <j-simard> ok, thanks both of you
